title: SK Innovation subsidized for Hungarian battery plant
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Hungary, with the second plant in Komárom and the third plant in Iváncsa, 50 kilometers southwest of Budapest.

Capacity:
- The second battery cell plant in Komárom is planned to have an annual capacity of 10 GWh. The company aims to expand its production capacities to a total of over 500 GWh by 2030.

Investment amounts:
- SK Innovation is investing about 945 billion won (approximately 700 million euros) in the construction of its second plant in Komárom. The Hungarian government has granted a subsidy of 90 million euros for the second plant.

Project progress:
- The construction of the second plant in Komárom is planned to be completed this year, with commercial production expected to begin in 2022. SK Innovation also decided to build a third battery cell factory in Hungary, specifically in Iváncsa.

Project type:
- The project involves the construction of a new battery cell plant in Komárom and the planned construction of a third battery cell factory in Iváncsa.

Value chain stages:
- The facility covers cell fabrication, as SK Innovation currently develops and produces pouch cells and is also looking into the development and production of new types of battery cells, including cylindrical and prismatic cells.

title: SK Innovation to build $859mn EV battery plant in Hungary
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Komárom, Hungary.

Capacity:
- The original facility in Komárom has a capacity of 7.5GW per hour.
- The new No.2 Komarom plant in Hungary is expected to add to the global capacity.

Investment amounts:
- SK Innovation announced an investment of US$859mn in the construction of the new electric vehicle battery plant in Komárom, Hungary.
- The original facility in Komárom cost approximately $350mn to construct.

Project progress:
- In 2018, SK Innovation began construction of the first plant in Komárom.
- The new No.2 Komarom plant is expected to be completed in 2021.

Project type:
- The new plant in Komárom, Hungary is an expansion of the first plant in Europe.

Value chain stages:
- The facility covers cell fabrication, as it is involved in the production of EV batteries.

Note: The article does not provide information on subsidies received for the project.

title: SK Innovation to invest 750 million euros in Hungarian battery plant
notes:

- The battery production project is located in Komarom, northern Hungary.

Capacity:

- Construction of the facility is set to begin in March, with production expected to start in late 2021 or early 2022.

Project type:
- The project is an expansion of SK Innovation's first plant in Europe.

title: SK Innovation To Build Third EV Battery Plant In Hungary
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Hungary, with the new factory to be located in Ivancsa.

Capacity:
- The new factory is planned to produce up to 30 GWh of cells annually, with the company's total battery manufacturing capacity expected to increase several times over just a few years.

Investment amounts:
- The initial investment in the new site is reported to be 1.3 trillion won ($1.16 billion), with the total cost expected to reach 2.6 trillion won ($2.3 billion) by 2028. Hungary plans to provide a significant investment subsidy, with the exact amount to be made public once the agreement is signed with SK Innovation and the process of notification with the EU has been completed.

Project progress:
- The construction of the new factory is scheduled to start in the third quarter of this year, with the start of production planned for early 2024. The plant is expected to be fully completed by 2028.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, with the construction of the new factory from scratch.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover the stages of cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly.

title: SK Battery Hungary
notes:
Location:
- Country: Hungary
- Region: Dunantul; Kozep-Dunantul; Komarom-Esztergom
- Location of affected unit(s): Komárom

Capacity:
- The first Hungary-based electric battery plant in Komárom is expected to launch production in August 2020.
- Another battery plant in the same town is under construction and expected to begin operation in late 2021.
- The combined workforce of the two plants is projected to create some 1,410 jobs initially, potentially reaching 2,500 by 2023.

Investment amounts:
- The investment cost of the two factories amounts to a combined HUF 416 billion (roughly €1.2 billion as at 23 April 2020).

Project progress:
- The Hungarian subsidiary of South Korean chemical enterprise SK Innovation is expected to launch production in its first Hungary-based electric battery plant in Komárom in August 2020.
- Another battery plant is under construction in the same town and is expected to begin operation in late 2021.
- The factories will manufacture batteries for electric cars.
- SK Innovation has expanded its Hungarian investment plan due to the explosion of demand for electric vehicle batteries.

Project type:
- Business expansion

Value chain stages:
- The project covers the manufacturing of batteries and accumulators.
